snippet: The report by the state inspector general’s office describes a troubling pattern of mistakes at New York City’s premier crime lab, also considered among the best in the country.
abstract: Report by New York State inspector general’s office describes pattern of mistakes at New York City’s premier crime lab, considered among best in nation; report was commissioned after New York Times revealed mistakes by technician Serrita Mitchel that caused her to overlook crucial evidence in a number of rape investigations; city medical examiner's office says numerous procedural changes have been put in place since Mitchell's errors were discovered.
lead_paragraph: The report by the state inspector general’s office describes a troubling pattern of mistakes at New York City’s premier crime lab, also considered among the best in the country.

headline.main: Report Details the Extent of a Crime Lab Technician’s Errors in Handling Evidence
headline.print_headline: Report Details the Extent of a Crime Lab Technician’s Errors in Handling Evidence

keywords.value: Office of the Chief Medical Examiner of the City of New York
keywords.name: organizations
